body_html:
Yes this is an error when building caffe2 as the title says, we're trying to compile from source. The error means it doesn't install it in the correct locations. But it leaves it's artifacts around. I'm just running the build anaconda script from the getting started guide. It gets to what I think is near the end and seems to try to load theibrary to test it and gets this error. Where would you like me to run those commands? I thought the artifacts of the build would be ok as they were the files it was trying to install.
…
________________________________ From: Paul Jesse Hellemn <notifications@github.com> Sent: Tuesday, June 5, 2018 8:22:27 PM To: pytorch/pytorch Cc: Luke Murray; Mention Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] [Caffe2][Bug report] Compiling for source on macOS for python3 gives Symbol not found: _PyCObject_Type in caffe2_pybind11_state.cpython-36m-darwin.so (#7963) @lukemurray<https://github.com/lukemurray> what directory are you in when running this? This folder /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld/caffe2_1528124553008/_test_env_placehold..... is only a temporary build folder created by conda-build. You should never try to run anything under the /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld folder and there should be no environment variables or paths pointing to any folder under /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld. If those are the only two locations where libcaffe2.dylib exists on your machine, then Caffe2 was never actually installed and there was some error during the make or install process. Does "conda list caffe2" show any results? It looks like a Caffe2 package was created, so maybe try "conda install caffe2 --use-local" — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#7963 (comment)>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAJj0bH_kRzVcjdhoUwMpHS_95ukNy65ks5t5r5TgaJpZM4UT_kD>.
body_text:
Yes this is an error when building caffe2 as the title says, we're trying to compile from source. The error means it doesn't install it in the correct locations. But it leaves it's artifacts around.

I'm just running the build anaconda script from the getting started guide. It gets to what I think is near the end and seems to try to load theibrary to test it and gets this error.

Where would you like me to run those commands? I thought the artifacts of the build would be ok as they were the files it was trying to install.
…
________________________________
From: Paul Jesse Hellemn <notifications@github.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 5, 2018 8:22:27 PM
To: pytorch/pytorch
Cc: Luke Murray; Mention
Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] [Caffe2][Bug report] Compiling for source on macOS for python3 gives Symbol not found: _PyCObject_Type in caffe2_pybind11_state.cpython-36m-darwin.so (#7963)


@lukemurray<https://github.com/lukemurray> what directory are you in when running this? This folder /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld/caffe2_1528124553008/_test_env_placehold..... is only a temporary build folder created by conda-build. You should never try to run anything under the /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld folder and there should be no environment variables or paths pointing to any folder under /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld.

If those are the only two locations where libcaffe2.dylib exists on your machine, then Caffe2 was never actually installed and there was some error during the make or install process. Does "conda list caffe2" show any results? It looks like a Caffe2 package was created, so maybe try "conda install caffe2 --use-local"

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#7963 (comment)>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAJj0bH_kRzVcjdhoUwMpHS_95ukNy65ks5t5r5TgaJpZM4UT_kD>.
body:
Yes this is an error when building caffe2 as the title says, we're trying to compile from source. The error means it doesn't install it in the correct locations. But it leaves it's artifacts around.

I'm just running the build anaconda script from the getting started guide. It gets to what I think is near the end and seems to try to load theibrary to test it and gets this error.

Where would you like me to run those commands? I thought the artifacts of the build would be ok as they were the files it was trying to install.

________________________________
From: Paul Jesse Hellemn <notifications@github.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 5, 2018 8:22:27 PM
To: pytorch/pytorch
Cc: Luke Murray; Mention
Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] [Caffe2][Bug report] Compiling for source on macOS for python3 gives Symbol not found: _PyCObject_Type in caffe2_pybind11_state.cpython-36m-darwin.so (#7963)


@lukemurray<https://github.com/lukemurray> what directory are you in when running this? This folder /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld/caffe2_1528124553008/_test_env_placehold..... is only a temporary build folder created by conda-build. You should never try to run anything under the /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld folder and there should be no environment variables or paths pointing to any folder under /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld.

If those are the only two locations where libcaffe2.dylib exists on your machine, then Caffe2 was never actually installed and there was some error during the make or install process. Does "conda list caffe2" show any results? It looks like a Caffe2 package was created, so maybe try "conda install caffe2 --use-local"

—
